text: This British mathematician is considered the father of theoretical computer science and artificial intelligence, known for developing the Turing machine and proposing the Turing Test to evaluate machine intelligence.
explanation: Alan Turing laid the foundations for AI with his work on computability and the concept of machines that can simulate human intelligence.

text: This American computer scientist coined the term 'Artificial Intelligence' in 1956 and invented the Lisp programming language, which became fundamental to AI research.
explanation: John McCarthy organized the Dartmouth Conference, the birthplace of AI as a field, and his contributions include time-sharing systems and garbage collection in programming.

text: This MIT professor co-founded the AI Laboratory and developed theories on human cognition, authoring 'The Society of Mind' which views intelligence as emerging from simple agents.
explanation: Marvin Minsky was a pioneer in neural networks and robotics, influencing generations of AI researchers with his interdisciplinary approach.

text: Known as one of the 'Godfathers of Deep Learning', this Canadian researcher founded the Vector Institute and won the Turing Award for contributions to deep neural networks.
explanation: Yoshua Bengio leads MILA in Montreal and has advanced generative models and sequence learning in AI.

text: This co-founder of DeepMind led the development of AlphaGo, which defeated the world champion in Go, and now serves as CEO of Google DeepMind.
explanation: Demis Hassabis combines neuroscience and AI, achieving breakthroughs in protein folding with AlphaFold.

text: This Stanford professor created ImageNet, revolutionizing computer vision, and is a leading voice in AI for healthcare and human-centered AI.
explanation: Fei-Fei Li's ImageNet dataset spurred the deep learning boom in visual recognition tasks.

text: This CEO of OpenAI oversaw the release of ChatGPT and advocates for AI safety, having previously led Y Combinator.
explanation: Sam Altman has been instrumental in scaling generative AI models and discussing AGI risks.

text: This Ethiopian-American researcher co-founded the Black in AI organization and was ousted from Google after raising concerns about bias in large language models.
explanation: Timnit Gebru's work focuses on AI ethics, algorithmic bias, and the societal impacts of technology.

text: This co-author of the standard AI textbook 'Artificial Intelligence: A Modern Approach' has warned about the risks of superintelligent AI and promotes human-compatible AI.
explanation: Stuart Russell's research spans probabilistic reasoning and AI safety, influencing policy on autonomous weapons.

text: This MIT professor pioneered affective computing, developing technologies that recognize and respond to human emotions, and founded Affectiva.
explanation: Rosalind Picard's work integrates AI with wearable sensors to improve mental health and human-computer interaction.
